U1cMPO.cmpo — Type

cMPO (for now, only nearest-neighboring (NN) interactions)

\[\left( \begin{array}{cc} Q & \mathbf{R}\\ \mathbf{L} & 0 \end{array} \right)\]

source
U1cMPO.cmps — Type

cMPS

source
U1cMPO.u1_matrix — Type

definition for matrices with U(1) block structures.

source
Base.:* — Method
*(x, m)

Number-Matrix multiplication.

source
Base.:* — Method
*(op1, op2)

Multiply cMPO op1 with cMPO op2.

source
Base.:* — Method
*(op, psi)

Act the cMPO op onto the cMPS psi, and return the new cMPS.

source
Base.:* — Method
*(phi, op)

Act the cMPO op to the left cMPS phi.

source
Base.:* — Method
*(phi, psi)

Return the K-matrix from the input cMPS phi and psi.

source
Base.:* — Method
*(m, x)

Number-Matrix multiplication.

source
Base.:* — Method
*(m1, m2)

Matrix multiplication.

source

+(m1, m2)

Add two matrices.

source
Base.:- — Method
-(m1, m2)

Calculate m1 - m2.

source
Base.:== — Method
==(m1, m2)

Return whether two matrices are identical.

source
Base.adjoint — Method
adjoint(m)

This function does nothing to the matrix. It is useful when calculating the adjoint (transpose) of a cMPO.

source
Base.isapprox — Method
isapprox(m1, m2)

Return whether two matrices are approximately identical.

source
Base.kron — Method
kron(m1, m2)

Tensor product of matrices.

source
Base.transpose — Method
transpose(m)

Take the transpose of a u1_matrix.

source
Base.vec — Method
vec(u1_matrix, is_diag=false)

Convert all the parameters (the data within the blocks) to a vector. If is_diag is set to true, then only take the diagonal elements.

rules for U1Matrix

LinearAlgebra.tr — Method
tr(m)

Trace of matrix.

U1cMPO.:⊗ — Method
⊗(m1, m2)

Tensor product of matrices.

source
U1cMPO.C_matrix — Method
C_matrix(psi, beta, tau)

A util function for the the calculation of the von-Neumann entropy which calculates the coefficent matrix. psi is cMPS, beta is the inversed temperature, and tau is the interval in the imaginary time. We have inserted some unitary matrices to maintain the U(1) block structure of the matrix.

source
U1cMPO.L2_theta_0 — Method
L2_theta_0(lmax)

Return the matrix representation for the kinetic term in quantum rotor model (no theta term).

source
U1cMPO.L2_theta_pi — Method
L2_theta_0(lmax)

Return the matrix representation for the kinetic term in quantum rotor model (theta=pi).

source
U1cMPO.X_theta_0 — Method
X_theta_0(M, lmax)

Return matrix representation of spherical tensor operator for ordinary quantum rotors.

source
U1cMPO.X_theta_pi — Method
X_theta_pi(M, lmax)

Return matrix representation of spherical tensor operator for quantum rotors decorated with a magnetic monopole (theta=pi).

source
U1cMPO.add_to_submat! — Method
add_to_submat!(m, subm_to_add, l_label, l_indices, r_indices)

Inplace modification of the U1 matrix m by adding some small matrix subm_to_add to it. The small matrix is added to the block corresponding to the quantum number l_label, within the sub-block indicated by the index ranges l_indices and r_indices.

source
U1cMPO.add_to_submat! — Method
add_to_submat!(m, subm_to_add, l_label)

Inplace modification of the U1 matrix m by adding some small matrix subm_to_add to it. The small matrix is added to the whole block corresponding to the quantum number l_label.

source
U1cMPO.blk_chk — Method
blk_chk(m1, m2)

Return whether two matrices has the same block structure.

source
U1cMPO.d_vec_0 — Method
d_vec_0(lmax)

Return the U(1) block structure given the largest l kept in the case of no theta term.

source
U1cMPO.d_vec_pi — Method
d_vec_pi(lmax)

Return the U(1) block structure given the largest l kept in the case of theta=pi.

source
U1cMPO.diagQ — Method
diagQ(psi)

Perform gauge transformation to cMPS psi so that its Q matrix is diagonalized.

source
U1cMPO.eigh — Method
eigh(m)

Eigendecomposition of a (symmetric) U1 matrix.

source
U1cMPO.energy — Method
energy(T, psi, beta)

Calculate energy from cMPO T, cMPS psi at inversed temperature beta.

source
U1cMPO.eye_u1m — Method
eye_u1m(T, d_vec)

Initialize an identity matrix of datatype T, and assign a block structure to it.

source
U1cMPO.eye_u1m — Method
eye_u1m(op)

Given a cMPO, generate an identity matrix according to its U(1) quantum number sectors.

source
U1cMPO.eye_u1m — Method
eye_u1m(psi)

Given a cMPS, generate an identity matrix according to its U(1) quantum number sectors.

source
U1cMPO.f_and_gf_gen — Method
f_and_gf_gen(T, params_to_cmps, beta)

Given a function params_to_cmps that convert parameter vector to cmps, the Hermtian cMPO T, and the inversed temperature beta, generate functions that calculate free energy and the corresponding gradient from parameters.

source
U1cMPO.fidel_and_gfidel_gen — Method
fidel_and_gfidel_gen(phi, params_to_cmps, beta)

Given a function params_to_cmps that convert parameter vector to cmps, the target cMPS phi, and the inversed temperature beta, generate functions that calculate free energy and the corresponding gradient from parameters.

source
U1cMPO.free_energy — Method
free_energy(T, psi, beta)

given cMPS psi, Hermitian cMPO T and the inversed temperature beta, calculate the free energy.

source
U1cMPO.init_diag_u1m — Method
init_diag_u1m(d_vec, params)

Initialize a diagonal matrix from a vector params, and then assign a block structure to it.

source
U1cMPO.init_u1m_by_params — Method
init_u1m_by_params(d_vec, qn, params)

An alternative initialization for u1_matrix from a vector of parameters.

source
U1cMPO.isometry_truncate — Method
isometry_truncate(m, v, msk_vec)

Truncate the U1 matrix m by an isometry matrix. We implement this by first transform the matrix by a orthogonal matrix v that has the same block structure with m, and then truncate the transformed U1 matrix according to the mask msk_vec, block by block.

source
U1cMPO.klein — Method
klein(Lpsi, psi, beta)

Calculate the klein bottle entropy from left cMPS Lpsi and right cMPS psi at inversed temperature beta.

source
U1cMPO.kron_bookkeeping — Method
kron_bookkeeping(d_vec1, d_vec2)

Utilization function for the calculation of the tensor product. Given two U(1) quantum number sectors, return

  • the new quantum number sector for the tensor product matrix.
  • a function that maps the qunatum numbers (n1, n2) corresponding to input quantum number sectors to the sub-block location (l, x0, x1) within the new matrix, where l is the new quantum number and x0 and x1 represent the beginning and ending point within in the block.
source
U1cMPO.l_labels_f — Method
l_labels_f(nlen, qn)

Given the total number nlen of the U(1) quantum numbers and the quantum number qn of the U1 matrix, return a vector that maps the index of the block to the U(1) quantum number of the block. For example, when qn=1, the first block corresponds to quantum number 1. when qn=-1, however, the first block corresponds to quantum number 2. (The U(1) quantum number is assumed to start from 1 to nlen.)

source
U1cMPO.log_tr_expm — Method
log_tr_expm(m, beta)

Calculates

\[\log \mathrm{Tr} \exp(\beta M)\]

source
U1cMPO.logsumexp — Method
logsumexp(w)

Calculation of logsumexp.

source
U1cMPO.ovlp — Method
ovlp(phi, psi, beta)

Given inversed temperature beta, calculate the log of the overlap between the cMPSs phi and psi

source
U1cMPO.params_len — Method
params_len(d_vec, qn)

Given the quantum number sector d_vec and the quantum number of the matrix qn, determine the total number of the parameters.

source
U1cMPO.pauli — Method
pauli(M)

Generate Pauli matrix (σ0, σ+, and σ-).

source
U1cMPO.pauli_id — Method
pauli_id()

Generate 2×2 identity matrix.

source
U1cMPO.reduced_density_matrix — Method
reduced_density_matrix(psi, beta)

For cMPS psi with imaginary-time length beta, construct the reduced density matrix. We have inserted some unitaries to maintain the U(1) block structure of the matrix.

source
U1cMPO.reflect — Method
reflect(psi)

reflect the matrices contained in the input cMPS psi. See also: reflect(m)

source
U1cMPO.reflect — Method
reflect(m)

reflect a u1_matrix. Equivalent to the following unitary tranformation

\[\left( \begin{array}{cccc} & & & 1\\ & & 1 & \\ & \udots & & \\ 1 & & & \end{array} \right)\]

source
U1cMPO.submat — Method
submat(m, n)

Return the block corresponding to U(1) quantum number n.

source
U1cMPO.symmetrize — Method
symmetrize(m)

Symmetrize the matrix by

\[(M + M^T) / 2\]

source
U1cMPO.toarray — Method
to_array(m)

Represent the U1 matrix as an ordinary 2D-array.

source
U1cMPO.trunc_msk_gen — Method
trunc_msk_gen(d_vec, w, num_kept)

Generate msk_vec for the function isometry_truncate(m, v, msk_vec). According to the block structure d_vec and some spectrum w, keep num_kept of states in the spectrum. Return a vector of BitVector that tells how to truncate a U1 matrix, block by block.

source
U1cMPO.truncate_according_to_rdm — Method
truncate_according_to_rdm(psi, chi, beta)

Truncate cMPS psi to target bond dimension chi at inversed temperature beta according to the reduced density matrix eigenvalues. The new U(1) quantum number sectors can be automatically determined from this process.

source
U1cMPO.von_neumann_entropy — Method
von_neumann_entropy(psi, beta, tau)

For cMPS psi, calculate the von-Neumann entropy between intervals τ and β-τ.

source
U1cMPO.zero_u1m — Method
zero_u1m(T, d_vec)

Initialize a zero matrix of datatype T, and assign a block structure to it.

source
